content: If there are no objections, I'd like to add cover art to this puzzle.

Nice one, easy to get only mostly correct, i.e. with off-by-one errors due to the "fat pixels" vs the "dimensionless point ball".

Also note an inconsistency between tests and text : "Off the paddle" tests have bricks with kY > 1500.

Backup: https://pastebin.com/6qwMynKA

Edited to take Stilgart's patches on player_one's code.

Edited the final two cases from my personal code's bounces so that the paddle follows the ball on row 2300 until the same score as previously is reached. This was directly possible on the test, and needed a slight Xvel adjustment on the validator (that also happened to run in a Corner Case with author's patched code)

So now it's not too dissimilar with the original's spirit, I'll approve.

I'd still like to analyze how close those bounces are to corners before it reaches publication ;-)

The provided solution seems to be bugged.


Line 340 should probably be :
           hitHorizontal = new WallHitInfo(new PointD(_ballPosition.X + _ballVector.X, - _ballVector.Y - _ballPosition.Y))

Line 354 should probably be :
           hitVertical = new WallHitInfo(new PointD(- _ballVector.X - _ballPosition.X, _ballPosition.Y + _ballVector.Y))

Very interesting puzzle about a classic game!

But what's the rule about float value of the position of the sizeless ball? For example: 

Initial position [100, 100], vector [-3, -1], it will crash on the left wall [0 0] --> [0, 2400], so the new position of the crash point should be [0, 66.666666....] or [0, 66] or [0, 67] ?

I have removed the confusing wording about how to handle the ball hitting the corner of an object, and I have checked to make sure that this doesn't happen in any of the tests. It is my intention to solve this puzzle again from scratch, using a different approach, to double check the results and to verify that there are definitely no corner hits.

That doesn't seem to make it converge with mine.

What score do you get with your own code on this?
https://pastebin.com/t3Ds10Gs

(crafted from last test case and my code to aim for 470)

RoboStac caught me off-guard, but it seems ok anyway.

Closest calls (bounces <1 off a corner, using exact rational arithmetic):

Escape Test: 0.4
Good Game Test: 0.24
Good Game Validator: 0.55
470, both with my Haskell code and my version of the C# solution.

Shit, must've micopied something.

Ok, my suggestion: I craft the same for the other validator. We update the code to something that passes in common with both our codes. And we can move on with this.

Would you mind pasting the updated p1 code somewhere?
